Package it.polimi.ingsw.gameLogic.model.match.player.personalBoard.warehouse

Class ExtraShelfWarehouse

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gameLogic.model.match.player.personalBoard.warehouse.ExtraShelfWarehouse
All Implemented Interfaces:
Warehouse, WarehouseDecorator
public class ExtraShelfWarehouse extends Object implements WarehouseDecorator
This class implements the extra warehouse with an additional shelf.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ExtraShelfWarehouse​(Warehouse oldWarehouse, PhysicalResource extraShelf)
    The constructor receives a PhysicalResource with quantity=shelfSize and puts it into extraShelfWarehouse splitting the quantity in shelfSize and the PhysicalResource in extraShelf with quantity=0.

    This method returns the shelves List, converted to a Map.

    This method returns the perfect disposition of the warehouse.

    boolean
    switchShelf​(int shelf1, int shelf2)
    This method considers all the problems and dynamics involved in switching resources between Extra and Basic shelves (such as type problems, resources quantity problems), then eventually does the switch.
    PhysicalResource
    take​(int shelf, int numResources)
    This method uses getWarehouseDisposition() to check the possibility of the move, then eventually does the job or delegates it to the lower shelves.

  • Constructor Details

    • ExtraShelfWarehouse

      public ExtraShelfWarehouse​(Warehouse oldWarehouse, PhysicalResource extraShelf)
      The constructor receives a PhysicalResource with quantity=shelfSize and puts it into extraShelfWarehouse splitting the quantity in shelfSize and the PhysicalResource in extraShelf with quantity=0.
      Parameters:
      oldWarehouse - is a reference to the last version of the warehouse (Concrete or already ExtraShelf)
      extraShelf - contains a resource that will define the type and quantity of the extraShelf.
      See Also:
      ConcreteWarehouse

    • take

      public PhysicalResource take​(int shelf, int numResources) throws NotEnoughResourcesException
      This method uses getWarehouseDisposition() to check the possibility of the move, then eventually does the job or delegates it to the lower shelves.
      Specified by:
      take in interface Warehouse
      Specified by:
      take in interface WarehouseDecorator
      Parameters:
      shelf - indicates the chosen shelf
      numResources - stays for the quantity of resources to take
      Returns:
      the requested resource
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourcesException - to check for resource availability
      See Also:
      ConcreteWarehouse

    • moveInShelf

      public boolean moveInShelf​(PhysicalResource res, int shelf) throws ShelfInsertException, InvalidQuantityException
      This method redefines the simple moveInShelf and extends it to the new slots. It also checks if the resource is of the same type of the leader shelf's one, even when quantity=0.
      Specified by:
      moveInShelf in interface Warehouse
      Specified by:
      moveInShelf in interface WarehouseDecorator
      Parameters:
      res - defines the resource to move
      shelf - indicates the chosen shelf
      Returns:
      true
      Throws:
      ShelfInsertException - for invalid "shelf" values or not compatible resources move attempts.
      InvalidQuantityException - when the resource is not present of the market buffer.
      See Also:
      ConcreteWarehouse

    • switchShelf

      public boolean switchShelf​(int shelf1, int shelf2) throws ShelfInsertException, InvalidOperationException
      This method considers all the problems and dynamics involved in switching resources between Extra and Basic shelves (such as type problems, resources quantity problems), then eventually does the switch.
      Specified by:
      switchShelf in interface Warehouse
      Specified by:
      switchShelf in interface WarehouseDecorator
      Parameters:
      shelf1 - stays for the first shelf
      shelf2 - stays for the second shelf
      Returns:
      true
      Throws:
      ShelfInsertException - for switching quantities-related problems and issues between basic-extra/extra-extra types.
      InvalidOperationException - for errors in parameters values.
      See Also:
      ConcreteWarehouse

    • getShelfSize

      public int getShelfSize​(int shelf)
      This method returns the size of the specified shelf: calls old warehouse versions if the request has to drill down.
      Specified by:
      getShelfSize in interface Warehouse
      Parameters:
      shelf - indicates the chosen shelf
      Returns:
      the busy size of the shelf
      See Also:
